title: How to Make Masala Bread

steps.headline: Sift your flour, and salt together.
steps.description: Ensure that you blend the salt in. If there is any direct contact between salt and yeast, the yeast will stop growing.

steps.headline: In a cup mix the dried yeast with a about 2 teaspoons of warm water, a pinch or two powdered sugar and some flour.
Once the yeast starts bubbling up (not too much just the first bubbles that come up), add it to the flour.
Mix in the oil and some warm water and create a not to tough dough.
Cover with a wet cloth and keep it aside for 45 minutes in a warm place.
In a small frying pan, warm up about a teaspoon of some oil (you can use vegetable oil.)
steps.description: Add the mustard seeds and cumin seeds so that they start crackling, add the curry leaves. Take it off the heat and immediately add the green chillies. Remove the cumin/mustard mixture from the oil and keep it aside.

steps.headline: After 45 minutes take the dough out and knead it vigorously.
Again cover with the wet cloth and keep it in a warm place for 15 minutes.
After the fifteen minutes, blend in the mustard/cumin well so it is evenly distributed in the dough.
You can either place the dough into a bread tin or make it into small buns and place them on a greased tray.
Cover with a wet cloth and keep it aside again for another 35 minutes.
Place the tray inside for baking.
steps.description: Remove once the outer cover a light golden brown.

steps.headline: Once cooled remove and serve with butter and Indian rasam!

text: Sift your flour, and salt together. Ensure that you blend the salt in. If there is any direct contact between salt and yeast, the yeast will stop growing. In a cup mix the dried yeast with a about 2 teaspoons of warm water, a pinch or two powdered sugar and some flour. Takes about 10 to 15 minutes. Once the yeast starts bubbling up (not too much just the first bubbles that come up), add it to the flour.  Mix in the oil and some warm water and create a not to tough dough.  Cover with a wet cloth and keep it aside for 45 minutes in a warm place.  In a small frying pan, warm up about a teaspoon of some oil (you can use vegetable oil.) Add the mustard seeds and cumin seeds so that they start crackling, add the curry leaves. Take it off the heat and immediately add the green chillies. Remove the cumin/mustard mixture from the oil and keep it aside. After 45 minutes take the dough out and knead it vigorously.  Again cover with the wet cloth and keep it in a warm place for 15 minutes.  After the fifteen minutes, blend in the mustard/cumin well so it is evenly distributed in the dough.  You can either place the dough into a bread tin or make it into small buns and place them on a greased tray.  Cover with a wet cloth and keep it aside again for another 35 minutes.  Preheat the oven to 175 degrees.  Place the tray inside for baking. Remove once the outer cover a light golden brown. Once cooled remove and serve with butter and Indian rasam!
